overview: Narrated by award-winning James Earl Jones, THE CLINTON 12 tells the compelling story of the integration of the FIRST public high school in the South as a result of the Brown vs the Board of Education decision by the US Supreme Court. The title refers to the 12 black teenagers who, in the fall of 1956 were forced to attend the all-whit high school in Clinton, Tennessee.
tagline: On August 27, 1956, twelve black teenagers entered Clinton High School for the first time. What followed shocked the world... and changed a nation.
title: The Clinton 12: A Documentary Film
